hooks.name: computed
hooks.description: A subscriber bridge that connects the Vue-like Dep system to React's state.

hooks.name: use-audio-recorder
hooks.description: Supported audio MIME types for recording.

hooks.name: use-auto-save
hooks.description: Configuration options for the useAutoSave hook.

hooks.name: use-battery
hooks.description: Represents the state of the battery.

hooks.name: use-boolean
hooks.description: The useBoolean return type.

hooks.name: use-breakpoint
hooks.description: Breakpoints from Tailwind V2

hooks.name: use-callback-ref
hooks.description: A custom hook that converts a callback to a ref to avoid triggering re-renders when passed as a prop or avoid re-executing effects when passed as a dependency ```tsx const handleClick = useCallbackRef((event: MouseEvent) => {   console.log("Clicked!", event); }); useEffect(() => {   window.addEventListener("click", handleClick);   return () => window.removeEventListener("click", handleClick); }, []); ```

hooks.name: use-click-any-where
hooks.description: Custom hook that handles click events anywhere on the document. ```tsx const handleClick = (event) => {   console.log('Document clicked!', event); }; // Attach click event handler to document useClickAnywhere(handleClick); ```

hooks.name: use-click-away
hooks.description: Supported touch events for the click-away listener.

hooks.name: use-conference-system
hooks.description: Configuration options for the conference system hook.

hooks.name: use-cookie
hooks.description: Options for customizing the behavior of the useCookie hook.

hooks.name: use-copy-to-clipboard
hooks.description: The copied text as `string` or `null` if nothing has been copied yet.

hooks.name: use-countdown
hooks.description: The countdown's options.

hooks.name: use-counter
hooks.description: The hook return type.

hooks.name: use-dark-mode
hooks.description: The hook options.

hooks.name: use-debounce-callback
hooks.description: Configuration options for controlling the behavior of the debounced function.

hooks.name: use-debounce-value
hooks.description: Hook options.

hooks.name: use-document-title
hooks.description: Hook options.

hooks.name: use-event-callback
hooks.description: Custom hook that creates a memoized event callback. ```tsx const handleClick = useEventCallback((event) => {   // Handle the event here }); ```

hooks.name: use-event-listener
hooks.description: Custom hook that attaches event listeners to DOM elements, the window, or media query lists. ```tsx // Example 1: Attach a window event listener useEventListener('resize', handleResize); ``` ```tsx // Example 2: Attach a document event listener with options const elementRef = useRef(document); useEventListener('click', handleClick, elementRef, { capture: true }); ``` ```tsx // Example 3: Attach an element event listener const buttonRef = useRef<HTMLButtonElement>(null); useEventListener('click', handleButtonClick, buttonRef); ```

hooks.name: use-fetch
hooks.description: Options for customizing the behavior of the useFetch hook. Extends the standard [`RequestInit`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RequestInit) interface.

hooks.name: use-fork-ref
hooks.description: Merges refs into a single memoized callback ref or `null`. ```tsx const rootRef = React.useRef<Instance>(null); const refFork = useForkRef(rootRef, props.ref); return (   <Root {...props} ref={refFork} /> ); ```

hooks.name: use-hover
hooks.description: Custom hook that tracks whether a DOM element is being hovered over. ```tsx const buttonRef = useRef<HTMLButtonElement>(null); const isHovered = useHover(buttonRef); // Access the isHovered variable to determine if the button is being hovered over. ```

hooks.name: use-indexed-db
hooks.description: Options for configuring the IndexedDB connection and behavior.

hooks.name: use-intersection-observer
hooks.description: The hook internal state.

hooks.name: use-interval
hooks.description: Custom hook that creates an interval that invokes a callback function at a specified delay using the [`setInterval API`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/setInterval). ```tsx const handleInterval = () => {   // Code to be executed at each interval }; useInterval(handleInterval, 1000); ```

hooks.name: use-is-client
hooks.description: Custom hook that determines if the code is running on the client side (in the browser). ```tsx const isClient = useIsClient(); // Use isClient to conditionally render or execute code specific to the client side. ```

hooks.name: use-is-mounted
hooks.description: Custom hook that determines if the component is currently mounted. ```tsx const isComponentMounted = useIsMounted(); // Use isComponentMounted() to check if the component is currently mounted before performing certain actions. ```

hooks.name: use-isomorphic-layout-effect
hooks.description: Custom hook that uses either `useLayoutEffect` or `useEffect` based on the environment (client-side or server-side). ```tsx useIsomorphicLayoutEffect(() => {   // Code to be executed during the layout phase on the client side }, [dependency1, dependency2]); ```

hooks.name: use-kbd
hooks.description:
Custom hook that detects the operating system (Mac vs. Windows/Linux) and provides a normalized map of keyboard keys (e.g., mapping "Meta" to "Command" on Mac and "Ctrl" on Windows). ```tsx const { isMac, getKbdKey } = useKbd(); // Returns "âŒ˜" on Mac, "Ctrl" on Windows const metaSymbol = getKbdKey('meta'); return
Press {metaSymbol} + C to copy
; ```

hooks.name: use-key
hooks.description: The function to call

hooks.name: use-local-storage
hooks.description: Options for customizing the behavior of serialization and deserialization.

hooks.name: use-map
hooks.description: Represents the type for either a Map or an array of key-value pairs.

hooks.name: use-media-quality
hooks.description: The current quality preset being used.

hooks.name: use-media-query
hooks.description: Hook options.

hooks.name: use-media-session
hooks.description: Represents an image associated with the media (e.g., album art).

hooks.name: use-network-information
hooks.description: Detailed information about the network connection.

hooks.name: use-portal
hooks.description: A safe, typed alternative to findDOMNode. Works with: 1. DOM Elements (returns them directly) 2. Ref Objects (returns .current) 3. Null/Undefined (returns null) NOT SUPPORTED: Passing a Class Component instance directly (legacy behavior). You must use a Ref for Components.

hooks.name: use-read-local-storage
hooks.description: Represents the type for the options available when reading from local storage.

hooks.name: use-resize-observer
hooks.description: The size of the observed element.

hooks.name: use-role-guard
hooks.description: The user object. If not provided, attempts to read from session storage.

hooks.name: use-screen
hooks.description: The hooks options.

hooks.name: use-screen-share
hooks.description: Boolean or specific constraints for the video track.

hooks.name: use-script
hooks.description: Script loading status.

hooks.name: use-scroll-lock
hooks.description: Hook options.

hooks.name: use-search-with-suggestions
hooks.description: The string trigger (e.g., ":user"). Auto-prefixed with ":" if missing.

hooks.name: use-session-storage
hooks.description: Represents the options for customizing the behavior of serialization and deserialization.

hooks.name: use-ssr
hooks.description: Whether code is running in the browser.

hooks.name: use-step
hooks.description: Represents the second element of the output of the `useStep` hook.

hooks.name: use-symbol
hooks.description: Creates a new unique symbol and adds it to the local registry.

hooks.name: use-ternary-dark-mode
hooks.description: Ternary dark mode options.

hooks.name: use-timeout
hooks.description: Custom hook that handles timeouts in React components using the [`setTimeout API`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/setTimeout). ```tsx // Usage of useTimeout hook useTimeout(() => {   // Code to be executed after the specified delay }, 1000); // Set a timeout of 1000 milliseconds (1 second) ```

hooks.name: use-toggle
hooks.description: Custom hook that manages a boolean toggle state in React components. a function to toggle the state, and a function to set the state explicitly. ```tsx const [isToggled, toggle, setToggle] = useToggle(); // Initial value is false // OR const [isToggled, toggle, setToggle] = useToggle(true); // Initial value is true // Use isToggled in your component, toggle to switch the state, setToggle to set the state explicitly. ```

hooks.name: use-unmount
hooks.description: Custom hook that runs a cleanup function when the component is unmounted. ```tsx useUnmount(() => {   // Cleanup logic here }); ```

hooks.name: use-user-media
hooks.description: Constraints for the `useUserMedia` hook. Defines the video and audio settings for the media stream.

hooks.name: use-window-size
hooks.description: Represent the dimension of the window.
